author: lightclient
content: we charge the maximum up front for the auth (e.g. it has to create a new account in the trie) and refund the difference once we actually look up the account to see if it exists

author: lightclient
content: this avoids the situation where a tx validity could depend on many state look ups

author: chfast
content: I think this deserves at least a rationale entry. Was a part of the original design? I'm thinking if this is worth the trouble.

author: chfast
content:
Having the authorization list:
1. (A, nonce=1)
2. (A, nonce=0)
3. (A, nonce=1)

We have:

1. no refund because fails but creates the account.
2. refund although A exists.
3. no refund because A exists.
